author: bridge-bot
content: <CarlBeek> starting to think deployment on the big machine is not going to be ready ahead of tomorrow

author: bridge-bot
content: <Recmo> fly.io is 3-5 sec to verify on their largest vps, so reasonably fast. Maybe we can spin up a second ‚Äòproduction‚Äô instance?

author: bridge-bot
content: <kevaundray> > <kevaundray>  Its possible but would be a stretch. Easiest course of action would be to upgrade fly.io (re @CarlBeek: starting to think deployment on the big machine is not going to be ready ahead of tomorrow)

author: bridge-bot
content: <CarlBeek> 3-5s doesn't sound unreasonable

author: bridge-bot
content: <Recmo> That‚Äôs using both Ark and Blst

author: bridge-bot
content: <CarlBeek> ok, great! how do we go about doing that?

author: bridge-bot
content:
<kevaundray> Upgrading the existing fly.io should take a few seconds from the dashboard I think, though if we want to move everything under the EF umbrella, then we would need to:

- Sign up for fly.io
- Sign up for OAuth (Github + SIWE)
- Clone the github repo and do `fly deploy`
- Add the redirect uris

author: bridge-bot
content: <kevaundray> Hmm though, we do want a dev branch which doesn't have the nonce=3 requirement for those testing, so maybe a separate instance would be best

author: bridge-bot
content: <Recmo> Also, review the config in fly.toml. There‚Äôs a couple of debug flags enabled like multi-contribution mode.

author: bridge-bot
content: <Recmo> definitely separate instance. we also don‚Äôt want to auto deploy master and we want to make sure we preserve the transcript and database

author: bridge-bot
content: <CarlBeek> Ok, it sounds like a separate deployment is the call here.

author: bridge-bot
content: <CarlBeek> What do you mean by sign up for OAuth (Github + SIWE)?

author: bridge-bot
content: <CarlBeek> also how does it work with multiple fly-api tokens in the GH secrets?

author: bridge-bot
content: <Recmo> > <Recmo>  Request clientid and secret for them. instructions are in the readme (re @CarlBeek: What do you mean by sign up for OAuth (Github + SIWE)?)

author: bridge-bot
content: <Recmo> those secrets need to be supplied to the process, on fly that is done using the ‚Äòfly secrets‚Äô subcommand

author: bridge-bot
content: <CarlBeek> i think we should can the idea of launching this fully as a testnet tomorrow and instead jut go with the demo. I'd need to sit down with one of you and have you walk me though deploying this as i'm out of my depth here

author: bridge-bot
content: <Recmo> > <Recmo>  I would deploy locally using CLI tool. No need to set up a Github actions pipeline. (re @CarlBeek: also how does it work with multiple fly-api tokens in the GH secrets?)
